person.persName: John Marshall Harlan (Kentucky politician, soldier, and attorney)

body.p: Kentucky politician, soldier, and attorney. Boyle County, Kentucky, native. Son of James L. Harlan, Sr. and Eliza S. Davenport Harlan. Married to Malvina French Shanklin Harlan in 1856. Graduated from Centre College in 1850. Studied law at Transylvania University. Adjutant General of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1851 to 1859. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1853. Member of the Whig Party. Frankfort City Attorney from 1854 to 1856. Judge of the Frankfort County Court from 1858 to 1859. Relocated to Louisville, Kentucky in 1861 and worked as an attorney in Louisville, with William F. Bullock. Colonel of the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from 1861 to 1863. Member of the Union Party. Attorney General of Kentucky from 1863 to 1867.
